meanings.definition: To strike with an open hand, especially on the buttocks as a punishment.
meanings.sent1: He was smacking the table to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The teacher caught the student smacking his friend on the back playfully.
meanings.sent3: The chef was smacking the dough to make the perfect bread rolls.
meanings.sent4: The waves were smacking against the shore, creating a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The boxer was smacking his opponent with powerful punches.

meanings.definition: A sharp sound made by a blow with an open hand.
meanings.sent1: The loud smacking of the door echoed through the hallway.
meanings.sent2: She heard the smacking of the ball hitting the wall in the gym.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected smacking of the balloon bursting made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The constant smacking of the drumsticks kept the beat alive.
meanings.sent5: The audience could hear the smacking of the actor's hands in the play.

meanings.definition: Having a taste or smell that is strong and sharp.
meanings.sent1: The smacking flavor of the spicy chili made his eyes water.
meanings.sent2: She wrinkled her nose at the smacking scent of the garbage.
meanings.sent3: The smacking aroma of freshly baked cookies filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The smacking taste of the sour lemon made her pucker her lips.
meanings.sent5: The smacking smell of the campfire brought back childhood memories.
